channel.title: [VB6] Allow only numbers in a textbox
channel.description:
Put this anywhere..
private sub text1_keypress(keyascii as integer) select case keyascil case is < 42 case 48 To 57 case else keyascil = 0 end select end sub

item.title: [VB6] Allow only numbers in a textbox

item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Private Sub Text1_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer) Select Case KeyAscii Case Is < 33 Case 48 To 57 Case Else KeyAscii = 0 End Select End Sub

item.source: [VB6] Allow only numbers in a textbox

item.title: [VB6] Allow only numbers in a textbox
item.dc:creator: @Freddy1990 Freddy1990
item.description:
@Freddy1990 wrote:

Hmm, that will still allow like exclamation marks and stuff, you should only allow the signs under 32 instead of 42

Private Sub Text1_KeyPress(KeyAscii As Integer) Select Case KeyAscii Case Is < 32 Case 48 To 57 Case Else KeyAscii = 0 End Select End Sub
(Or 33 if you want the space included)
It’s a nice constribution though, useful for several programs.

Read full topic
item.source: [VB6] Allow only numbers in a textbox

item.title: [VB6] Allow only numbers in a textbox
item.dc:creator: @hellou hellou
item.description:
@hellou wrote:

Put this anywhere…

private sub text1_keypress(keyascii as integer)
select case keyascil
case is < 42
case 48 To 57
case else
keyascil = 0
end select
end sub

Read full topic
